titleStmt.title: Nelson Baird et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8716

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: Your undersigned petitioners would Respectfully Represent that A Judgement was Rendered in a Justice Court in Daviss County to wit J. A. Robertson ^cousin^ Against William A Mitchell in the name of the Commonwealth for disturbing Religious worship -- your petitioners would State that Mr Mitchell young not twenty one years of age peacably disposed and has been quiet all the time during the troubles in our Country and we believe him to be A union man
Also he is An industrious good Citizen peacably disposed and we Respectfully Ask that your Excellency will Remit the fine imposed on him Jany 19th 1863

Nelson Baird
Samuel A. Walis
W,, R. Ligon
J. A. Robertson
John H. Lemons
James Waltrip
John H Hogden
R. L. Head
A Riggs Jr
Nathan Baughn
A Riggs Sr
S. C. Baughn
J T Baughn
Banister, W. Dickens
D. C. Robertson
Solomon Aams
Fayette Riggs
William Riggs
Thos J Brooks
Green Kenady
Henry Austin
J H Taylor
Fenby Jones
Nazra Jones
William Brooks
Lawrence Goff
Handley Baird

Com
William A. Mitchell
Pettn to remit fine
Daviess J. P. Ct.

J F Robinson
$10. } Disturbing Worship
Iss Feby 9. 1863
